results.title: Planning a city
results.brief_description: Sydney, the second greatest white city in the British Empire. A critical analysis of Sydney and the initial lack of city planning. Despite the surrounding beauty and the opportunity for wise planning, Sydney became a crowded and poorly serviced city. Many houses were built on narrow, cramped and dimly lit streets which contributed to the escalation of crime and disease. Those responsible for constructing roadways rarely considered the impact on residents. Many schools and shopping centres were built on major thoroughfares resulting in a high rate of school children and housewives being killed by cars. Considering the harbourside location, many of the views became obstructed by buildings housing the privileged. The ‘Town and Country Planning Act of 1945’ was introduced to provide an opportunity to remedy the mistakes of the past by planning for future improvements. This film includes scenes of Sydney as it was in the middle of this century and what is now historical footage of cars, buses, trams, trains, ferries and horse and carts.

results.title: Tandberg on page one
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Ron Tandberg is Australia’s best known political cartoonist. This film follows through Tandberg’s work on the front page of the Melbourne ‘Age’ on one particular night’s edition. This document is significant for its depiction of the production of a broadsheet newspaper (including it printing) in 1983 and the dramatic change in production since computerisation was introduced shortly afterwards.

results.title: Australian vintage
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film explores the development of the wine industry in Australia with particular reference to Australia’s international status as a wine producing country. Features an appearance by winemaker and writer Len Evans.

results.title: Life is More Pleasant with Wine
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents the joys of drinking wine, a harmonious accompaniment to many activities. Suggests times, places and accompaniments for wine; discusses the qualities and features of each type of wine, the type of glass required; and how best to serve it.

results.title: [Ted Parsons Home Movies: Reel 6]
results.brief_description:
Ted Parsons was a keen amateur filmmaker of the 1940s to 1960s. Ted’s films feature life in and around the Victorian regional city of Wangaratta post-war. This was a period of prosperity and optimism largely due to a successful textile industry that took Wangaratta from a small country town to major rural city, declared in 1959.

Ted captures the many sporting and social events, venues and clubs, holidays and travel along with scenes of everyday life. The collection also shows the broader issues faced by country people such as the regular flooding events around the Ovens and King Rivers.

Wangaratta’s success story as a manufacturing town traces the path of post-war migration and the accompanying growth of Australia’s economy, which makes these films particularly interesting.

The Ted Parsons Home Movie Collection has been donated to ACMI by the filmmaker’s grandson Barry Parsons. The films have been made on 16mm film.

This film consists of a range of scenes filmed throughout the 1950s on various holidays. It features travels to Melbourne for the Royal Tour, a trip to Beechworth for a town parade and snippets of travels to Queensland and New South Wales.

A highlight of the film is footage of the Royal Tour in 1954, showing crowds of people in the streets of Melbourne and Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip driving past.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 ships in Port Melbourne with flags flying
00:00:30:00 crowds gathered at the railing
00:00:39:00 the ‘Princess of Tasmania’
00:01:11:00 large crowds of people in the city street, running and waving as the cavalcade passes by
00:02:21:00 panning across Melbourne city buildings and bridge across the Yarra River including advertising for ‘Bushells’ tea on a building
00:02:42:00 Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip pass by in an open car, waving at the crowd
00:02:59:00 crowds at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl in the King’s Domain, Melbourne
00:03:46:00 sign reads ‘The Sir Colin Mackenzie Sanctuary’, Healesville, followed by scenes of wildlife in the sanctuary
00:06:40:00 a visit to a farmhouse, views of horses in the country paddocks and women horseriding
00:07:10:00 a foal feeding from a mare
00:07:44:00 a woman in a printed sun dress holding a skittish foal by the bridle
00:08:17:00 Parliament House, Melbourne
00:08:18:00 flooded river with fallen trees after a storm
00:08:40:00 scenes of countryside
00:09:10:00 a family on a rocky outcrop surrounded by gum trees, pointing to the view
00:09:13:00 woman feeding peacocks
00:09:34:00 seaside scenes, sailboat on the water
00:10:20:00 cherry trees
00:10:41:00 garden with a sprinkler
00:11:00:00 parade through town centre of Beechworth, with people dressed in the fashion of the gold rush era
00:11:17:00 woman dancing in emerald green dress and bonnet, showing her white bloomers
00:11:24:00 man with wheelbarrow and sign reading ‘Melbourne to Beechworth or bust’
00:11:41:00 parade crowds with advertising signs and shopfronts behind: ‘The Dolphin Coffee Parlour’ and ‘Peters Ice Cream’
00:11:46:00 people in parade dressed as gold prospectors in stereotypical Chinese outfits
00:12:02:00 a group of people wearing a dragon costume
00:12:16:00 a child in a blackface costume
00:12:57:00 lovely printed dresses on women in the crowd
00:13:00:00 members of the parade dancing in costume
00:13:38:00 a Shetland pony harnessed to a small carriage with young girl seated inside
00:13:59:00 close-ups of flowers, butterflies and bees
00:14:38:00 beach scenes including people wearing printed bathers
00:14:48:00 Galapagos turtle
00:15:11:00 dolphins playing with balls in the Pet Porpoise Pool, Coffs Harbour
00:15:28:00 toll booths on the Sydney Harbour Bridge, with sign reading ‘Lane changing prohibited’
00:15:32:00 driving across the Sydney Harbour Bridge
00:16:08:00 bulldozer clearing a path on a country property

results.title: [Ted Parsons Home Movies: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
Ted Parsons was a keen amateur filmmaker of the 1940s to 1960s. Ted’s films feature life in and around the Victorian regional city of Wangaratta post-war. This was a period of prosperity and optimism largely due to a successful textile industry that took Wangaratta from a small country town to major rural city, declared in 1959.

Ted captures the many sporting and social events, venues and clubs, holidays and travel along with scenes of everyday life. The collection also shows the broader issues faced by country people such as the regular flooding events around the Ovens and King Rivers.

Wangaratta’s success story as a manufacturing town traces the path of post-war migration and the accompanying growth of Australia’s economy, which makes these films particularly interesting.

The Ted Parsons Home Movie Collection has been donated to ACMI by the filmmaker’s grandson Barry Parsons. The films have been made on 16mm film.

This film takes place on the Jubilee Golf Course in Wangaratta, in its original location on a property on Yarrawonga Road. The club was established in 1935 and in 1963 moved to its present location on Wangandary Road. Ted was President of the Jubilee Golf Club from 1939 to 1955, as shown by a plaque in a cigarette box he received. The film features scenes of the locals playing games of golf and the 1956 Grand Tournament, and features some great examples of 1950s sporting fashion.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 sign ‘Jubilee Golf Club’
00:00:14:00 scenes of the golf course and golfers teeing off
00:01:28:00 women chatting at the weatherboard club building
00:01:46:00 four female golfers cross the course with their golf clubs, wearing pleated skirts and cardigans
00:02:07:00 view up the hill to golfers amongst the trees
00:02:42:00 a group of golfers under a large tree; two women tee off while a group of men look on
00:03:24:00 views across the course
00:05:35:00 stylish golfer in brown check skirt and pink cardigan
00:06:27:00 two men in woollen flat caps
00:06:44:00 golfers gathered outside the golf club, a modest weatherboard building
00:06:53:00 poster for ‘Grand Tournament Wangaratta Jubilee Golf Club’
00:07:49:00 several men tee off in front of the club house as crowd applauds
00:08:36:00 championship board
00:09:02:00 presentation table set up with flowers, six glasses on a silver platter and wooden cigarette box
00:09:13:00 focus on cigarette box with interior sign ‘Presented to E.J. Parsons’
00:09:25:00 more views of golfers on the course

results.title: Australian Heritage: holly green country
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Shows the oldest existing homestead in Victoria, Holly Green farm 1836. Also Rupertswood 1870, and Glen Eira homestead 1857. Written by Eileen Berry.

results.title: Showtime
results.creator_credit: Anne Bourke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description:
A film of the Royal Melbourne Show as seen through the eyes of a family group. Grandfather, a retired farmer, takes his daughter and her two teenage children to the show. To people like breeders of livestock, farmers and agricultural equipment salesmen, the show is an important yearly event, but for the family there is something to interest each member. Cooking demonstrations, displays of horsemanship, and the extensive pavilions showing domestic pets as well as farm animals all have their appeal.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:14:00 animated graphics title ‘Showtime’, ‘produced by State Film Centre Victoria Westrex Sound’
00:00:30:00 a 1950s model crane truck
00:00:45:00 a 1950s model electricians van with lettering for ‘RHC Sound System’
00:00:57:00 scenes of preparing for the Show - cleaning, painting tyres and signs, brushing cattle
00:01:26:00 first look at animals on show in the main arena
00:02:16:00 draft horses
00:02:26:00 goats
00:02:35:00 and showing off the fleece on a large ram and holding a large rooster up to the camera
00:02:50:00 the Berkshire pigs at the Show
00:03:02:00 a ‘red rattler’ style Show Special train pulls into the platform and people disembark, including the narrator and his family who quickly start looking at exhibits at the Show
00:03:53:00 first showbag pavilion
00:04:05:00 signs for popular soft drink at the time. Tarax
00:04:30:00 the Guernsey cattle pavilion
00:05:06:00 bundles of wheat and Government information about wheat on display
00:05:29:00 baby hen chicks
00:05:55:00 large flock of sheep
00:06:05:00 Centenary Hall at the Melbourne Showgrounds followed by exhibitions of shearing sheep with hand shears and then with electric shears
00:06:35:00 a fashion parade at the Show followed by doll making and hand knits craft exhibition
00:07:27:00 looking at exhibitions of food preservation, tiered wedding cakes, and cooking class on laminations
00:07:45:00 whitegoods exhibition beginning with a well stocked drinks cabinet with built in fridge and semi-automatic washing machine in action
00:07:59:00 an exhibition set up as a butchers shop shows sausage making
00:08:15:00 the wood-chopping exhibition and competition at the Show followed by exhibition of different types of chainsaws
00:09:00:00 the diary pavilion
00:09:17:00 inspecting the brand new, shining Massey-Ferguson tractors tried out by very keen young man of the family
00:09:44:00 new motor cars on show including a promotion for the new Ford Zephyr
00:09:55:00 carnival rides including the ‘Noddy Car Ride’ (character featured in Enid Blyton books)
00:10:30:00 aerial view of the Showgrounds
00:10:46:00 sideshow tents
00:11:47:00 fairy floss tent
00:11:55:00 cut flowers pavilion
00:12:16:00 dog show
00:13:30:00 the Australian Mint exhibition followed by several show bag stalls
00:14:15:00 crowds at the main arena followed by horse jumping, harness racing and other competitions, including what might be sheaf sack tossing
00:15:09:00 the Grand Parade in the main arena at the Show which includes many of the exhibitors, winners and placegetters
00:17:07:00 fireworks and title ‘The End’
